reviews.review_msg: Super nice and very good at engaging students in lectures. I did just feel this class was a bit redundant and unnecessary.
Very nice person, but the first assignment went very poorly for myself. After that though the rest of the semester went very well.
She is smart, compassionate, and knows how to teach.The course is useful. I am happy I took this course.
Useful course
Prepare to read a lot and write a lot! Quite intensive! Good use of my tuition fees. I just didn't like the TA. He had writing issues himself.

Engaging classes, fun and helpful although you will be on your toes and will be biting your nails. I always looked forward to her classes. She us like a tough mama to me tough but caring. Definitely learned mire than expected.

Absolutely awful professor. In class, her communication is that of an AI. No emotions shown at all. 

Grading wise, she is the worst you can ever meet. She grades entirely based on what she likes, not what English rules dictate. Her grading system should be considered a hazardous carcinogenic. 

Will not take again, horrendous lectures and TA.
Lots of reading and writing but nice professor. I learned a lot.
Worst ever
I took her course in Fall2022. It was by far the most helpful course for me.
Hard working ng, knowledgable, compassionate

Honestly, We spent most of the classes dealing with technical issues. There were no standards or care for anything done. This was the biggest waste of time. Sepideh had alright taught a number of semesters online before this course. Was just unacceptable. I left the course learning literally nothing new. But hey, free A right?
He teaches as he hates you. Leaves everything to TA and doesn't even help when you personally ask him questions. Sending him emails and you will get very rude responses.

Very caring professor, unfortunately I had to drop the course for medical reasons but she truly went above and beyond to accommodate me any way she could. Lectures were good and she made it engaging by letting students speak their minds. I would take this professor again 100% for this course after the withdrawal, really sweet and positive.(Eco 290)
good prof . No complaints.
I like her as she is fair when it comes to students. She explains the concepts clearly and listens to the students feedback attentively. You feel heard .
Maliha is a caring professor. I thought i would fail the course but she was understanding and accommodating . She always encourages the students

Very approachable professor and kind hearted. I passed this course and failed it earlier with another professor. She is not a tough grader and communicates so clearly about the topics and sets clear expectations in the beginning.

She is so kind and nice. Most students are international students and she understands that students have language barriers so she was so encouraging  for every one. I never felt uncomfortable in her class and it felt like a safe place to voice our views.
She is new at SFU but taught very well.

Very nice and caring professor who listens to the student and makes changes based on their needs. She even allowed us to use AI once in the class and compared the answers generated by AI. She explains very well.
Class with her felt like a nourishing experienceâ€”intellectually satisfying and never overwhelming. Highly recommend if you want a professor who serves up knowledge with care and excellence!

Her lectures are clear, engaging. She cares about her students' success and is always willing to help outside of class and her feedback is constructive. I left her class feeling not only more knowledgeable but also more confident. Highly recommend her.
She is a patient professor and a good listener.
Amazing and caring professor.

Due to Dr. Nazir's support throughout the course, I was able to get a good grade. She listens to her students and is very accommodating. The course was writing intensive and i learnt a lot from her. Best professor for ECON 220 W

Her lectures are incredibly bland, and pointless but you go anyways because of participation marks. During tutorials we answered prompts from articles, 50min for 200 words. Gives us article to "use." didn't need it. The final she gives 3 articles, 1 we didn't use - wasted time and 2 prompts each 200 words in 40min. Scammed. Give me my money back.

I know many people will look at this review and still take her class because they have to. However, she is extremely disorganized, and the course is just writing. Honestly didn't mind, but I learned nothing. quizzes and test isn't hard. All we did is read articles and answer prompts. I feel scammed from the final and this course.

Worst lecture experience

accent = hard to comprehend

canvas is a mess

lectures are useless

nobody go to lectures

such a hard time

marks are ok, if work hard

need to change
Pretty good! The course is very hard to gain up your GPA!
